result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus N Longino

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:41 AM Defendant Marcus N Longino in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Marcus N Longino.  Prosecuting attorney William Leroy Brown in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense would like medical records before considering plea offer.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:03 AM Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Marcus N Longino.  Prosecuting attorney William Leroy Brown in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Global offer tendered, Atty Gonzalez will inform the court after meeting with DE.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information & enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
branch 13

10:09 AM Defendant Marcus N Longino in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Marcus N Longino.  Attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. T Coyne, MAPD duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Rennicke. Cross by Atty Gonzalez. Witness excused. Det. K Kalka, MAPD, duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Rennicke. Cross by Atty Gonzalez. Re-direct by ADA Rennicke. Witness excused. No further witnesses. ADA moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty Gonzalez objects, waives argument. CT finds probable cause & grants bindover.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:53 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court, in custody.  Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes Atty Gonzalez contacted the Court he is unavailable and requests a reschedule. State does not object. Court will reschedule.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has one witness ready for today prelim, but does not have a second witness available. Atty Gonzalez objects to a set over. Court makes findings and finds good cause to set this case over.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

04:29 PM  Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. Attorney Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Lennon requests setover in cases 22CF708 and 22CF413 due to officers being unavailable; explanation provided; this is State's 1st request for setover.  Atty Gonzalez objects with argument; requests signature bond or dismissal without prejudice.  Court grants State's request for setover; PH will be scheduled in 3 wks (Atty Gonzalez not avail in 2 wks).  State should not request/receive any add'l setovers.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney has been appointed. Requesting PH be scheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Jason Gonzalez
Report of Judicial Efforts to Appoint Counsel
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Marcus N Longino in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court finds DE is elligble for SPD appointment but have been unable to obtain counsel for DE. Court to attempt to appoint counsel at county expense, makes findings under Lee that DE's constitutional rights are not violated by failure to appoint counsel by the state.
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Marcus N Longino in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Benjamin Wagner appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court sets over status to 5-12 at 11:30am for cases to remain together, court to review attempts to obtain counsel.
Email correspondence from Secretary to SPD re: appointment of Atty Gonzalez, no response rec'd
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE qualifies for SPD, has been in contact. Court finds good cause to set another hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
SPD appointment status - Marcus Longino is eligible for SPD.  An atty has not been appointed yet.
Request to Appoint Atty Gonzalez as Counsel- DE
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Email from SPD; defn is eligible but there is a conflict and no attorney has been appointed as of yet and unsure if one will be appointed by 4-19-22 status conference date
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:34 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE wants atty.  CT advises DE of right to atty & to apply to SPD f/w.  CT finds good cause to extend time limits. Bail cont'd; set STC in 3 weeks. DE given notice in hand.
OSP Appointment of Counsel Report
Zoom

File Review on March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jason B. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

03:51 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Devonte D Windham.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  File Review scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
